info.title: FulfillmentRequest
info.description: The FulfillmentRequest resource represents a fulfillment request made by the merchant to a fulfillment service for a fulfillment order.

paths.description: Sends a fulfillment request to the fulfillment service of a fulfillment order.

parameters.name: fulfillment_order_line_items
parameters.description: The fulfillment order line items to be requested for fulfillment. If left blank, all line items of the fulfillment order are requested for fulfillment.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An optional message for the fulfillment request.

x-examples.name: Sends a fulfillment request to the fulfillment service for all line items on the fulfillment order if fulfillment_order_line_items is left blank

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"fulfillment_request":{"message":"Fulfill this ASAP please."}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/fulfillment_orders/1046000788/fulfillment_request.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

fulfillment_request = ShopifyAPI::FulfillmentRequest.new(session: test_session)
fulfillment_request.fulfillment_order_id = 1046000788
fulfillment_request.message = "Fulfill this ASAP please."
fulfillment_request.save!

paths.description: Accepts a fulfillment request sent to a fulfillment service for a fulfillment order.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An optional reason for accepting the fulfillment request.

request.body: {"fulfillment_request":{"message":"We will start processing your fulfillment on the next business day."}}

x-examples.name: Accepts a fulfillment request sent to a fulfillment service and updates the fulfillment order

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"fulfillment_request":{"message":"We will start processing your fulfillment on the next business day."}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/fulfillment_orders/1046000783/fulfillment_request/accept.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

fulfillment_request = ShopifyAPI::FulfillmentRequest.new(session: test_session)
fulfillment_request.fulfillment_order_id = 1046000783
fulfillment_request.accept(
  session: test_session,
  body: {"fulfillment_request" => {"message" => "We will start processing your fulfillment on the next business day."}},
)

paths.description: Rejects a fulfillment request sent to a fulfillment service for a fulfillment order.

parameters.name: line_items
parameters.description:
An optional array of rejected line items. Each line item has the following properties:
  • fulfillment_order_line_item_id: An identifier for the rejected line item.
  • message: An optional message for rejecting the line item. (150 characters maximum)

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An optional message for rejecting the fulfillment request.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: An optional reason for the fulfillment request rejection.

incorrect_address.summary: The fulfillment request was rejected because of an incorrect address.

inventory_out_of_stock.summary: The fulfillment request was rejected because inventory is out of stock.

ineligible_product.summary: The fulfillment request was rejected because of an ineligible product.

undeliverable_destination.summary: The fulfillment request was rejected because of an undeliverable destination.

other.summary: The fulfillment request was rejected for another reason.

request.body: {"fulfillment_request":{"message":"Not enough inventory on hand to complete the work.","reason":"inventory_out_of_stock","line_items":[{"fulfillment_order_line_item_id":1058737499,"message":"Not enough inventory."}]}}

x-examples.name: Rejects a fulfillment request sent to a fulfillment service and updates the fulfillment order

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"fulfillment_request":{"message":"Not enough inventory on hand to complete the work.","reason":"inventory_out_of_stock","line_items":[{"fulfillment_order_line_item_id":1058737499,"message":"Not enough inventory."}]}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-07/fulfillment_orders/1046000784/fulfillment_request/reject.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

fulfillment_request = ShopifyAPI::FulfillmentRequest.new(session: test_session)
fulfillment_request.fulfillment_order_id = 1046000784
fulfillment_request.reject(
  session: test_session,
  body: {"fulfillment_request" => {"message" => "Not enough inventory on hand to complete the work.", "reason" => "inventory_out_of_stock", "line_items" => [{"fulfillment_order_line_item_id" => 1058737499, "message" => "Not enough inventory."}]}},
)

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Manage the fulfillment request flow of fulfillment orders assigned to fulfillment services.
